cpu.name: ARM7TDMI
cpu.notes: ARM7TDMI CPU used in GBA, supports ARM and Thumb states

banking_model.notes: GBA cartridges typically do not use bank switching

regions.name: GBA Cartridge Header
regions.notes: Standard fixed GBA cartridge header located at the beginning of the ROM.

regions.name: ROM Entry Point
regions.notes: 32-bit ARM branch instruction

regions.name: Nintendo Logo
regions.notes: Compressed bitmap, must match official logo

default_value_mapped.meaning: Normal game; Not used yet, but might be used for even newer titles
Famicom/Classic NES Series (software emulated NES games)
Yoshi and Koro Koro Puzzle (acceleration sensor)
e-Reader (dot-code scanner) (or NDS PassMe image when gamecode='PASS')
Warioware Twisted (cartridge with rumble and z-axis gyro sensor)
Boktai 1 and 2 (cartridge with RTC and solar sensor)

regions.name: Main Unit Code
regions.notes: 00h for standard GBA

regions.name: Header Checksum
regions.notes: Complement check of bytes 0xA0–0xBC

gba.header.multiboot.name: GBA Multiboot Extension
gba.header.multiboot.notes: Optional multiboot extension for Normal, Multiplay and Joybus modes.

default_value_mapped.meaning: Init as 00h - BIOS overwrites this value
Init as 00h - BIOS overwrites this value

gba.address_map.standard.name: GBA Address Map
gba.address_map.standard.notes: Fixed memory map of the Game Boy Advance CPU.

regions.name: Game Pak ROM
regions.notes: Up to 32MB of ROM space.

regions.name: External WRAM
regions.notes: 256KB external work RAM.

regions.name: Internal WRAM
regions.notes: 32KB internal work RAM.

gba.vectors.standard.name: GBA ARM Exception Vectors
gba.vectors.standard.notes:
ARM exception vector table.
Most vectors contain a branch instruction to actual handlers.
Only the reset vector is strictly required for execution.

regions.name: Reset Vector
regions.notes: Executed immediately after BIOS initialization.

regions.name: Reserved Vector
regions.notes: Reserved; typically unused.

gba.cartridge.save_map.name: GBA Save Memory Address Windows
gba.cartridge.save_map.notes:
Standardized save memory windows used by commercial cartridges.
EEPROM uses a serial protocol; actual size varies (512B–8KB). Mapped window represents CPU-visible address range, not physical size.

regions.name: SRAM Save Area
regions.notes: 64KB SRAM window (used by SRAM and FLASH emulation).

regions.name: EEPROM Save Interface
regions.notes: EEPROM interface (addressed via serial protocol).

snes.name: Super Nintendo Entertainment System
snes.notes: SNES cartridge header is not used by the console hardware at runtime; it is metadata for development tools and emulators.

banking_model.notes: Bank size and decoding depend on mapping type.

regions.name: Game Title
regions.notes: Uppercase ASCII title, padded with spaces. Used by tools and emulators; not required by hardware.

regions.name: Map Mode
regions.notes:
Determines memory mapping and access speed.
Bit 7: FastROM flag
Lower bits: mapping type (LoROM / HiROM / ExHiROM).
This value is essential to locate the correct header.

regions.name: ROM Type
regions.notes:
Indicates presence of SRAM, battery, or coprocessors.
Many advanced cartridges include additional CPUs or logic.

regions.name: ROM Size
regions.notes:
Encoded as power-of-two size.
Value N represents ROM size = 2^(N+10) bytes.
Some ROMs lie about this value; file size is authoritative.

regions.name: SRAM Size
regions.notes: 0 indicates no SRAM. Otherwise encoded similarly to ROM size.

regions.name: Country Code
regions.notes: Used for regional lockout and video mode assumptions.

regions.name: Licensee Code
regions.notes: Publisher/licensee identifier. Poorly standardized.

regions.name: Checksum Complement
regions.notes: Bitwise complement of the checksum.

regions.name: Checksum
regions.notes:
16-bit checksum of the entire ROM.
Frequently incorrect in homebrew and modified ROMs.
Used mainly by tools, not by the console itself.

Used mainly by tools, not by the console itself.

snes.header.exhirom.name: SNES Internal Header (ExHiROM)
snes.header.exhirom.notes: Extended HiROM header for very large cartridges.

snes.vectors.lorom.name: SNES CPU Vectors (LoROM)
snes.vectors.lorom.notes: CPU exception and reset vectors for LoROM cartridges.

snes.vectors.hirom.name: SNES CPU Vectors (HiROM)
snes.vectors.hirom.notes: CPU exception and reset vectors for HiROM cartridges.

snes.address_map.lorom.name: SNES Address Map (LoROM)
snes.address_map.lorom.notes:
Logical memory map for LoROM cartridges.
This address map is a logical representation of the SNES memory model. Actual physical mapping is banked and depends on mapper.

snes.address_map.hirom.name: SNES Address Map (HiROM)
snes.address_map.hirom.notes:
Logical memory map for HiROM cartridges.
This address map is a logical representation of the SNES memory model. Actual physical mapping is banked and depends on mapper.

cpu.name: Motorola 68000
cpu.notes: Main CPU used for game logic and execution.

sg.header.standard.name: Sega Genesis / Mega Drive Header
sg.header.standard.notes:
Single fixed header layout for all standard cartridges.
Checksum is frequently incorrect in commercial ROMs; many emulators ignore this field.

regions.name: Console Name
regions.notes: Used by emulators for informal validation.

regions.name: Product Code
regions.notes: Internal Sega identifier (GM XXXXX-XX).

regions.name: ROM Checksum
regions.notes: Often incorrect even in official cartridges.

regions.name: I/O Support
regions.notes: Peripheral support hints (often unreliable).

regions.name: Backup RAM ID
regions.notes: Indicates presence/type of battery-backed RAM.

regions.name: Modem Info
regions.notes: Used by Sega Meganet titles.

sg.address_map.standard.name: SG/MD Address Map
sg.address_map.standard.notes: Logical memory map of the Mega Drive.

regions.name: Cartridge ROM
regions.notes: Up to 4MB of ROM space.

regions.name: Main Work RAM
regions.notes: 64KB system RAM.

sg.vectors.standard.name: SG/MD CPU Vectors (68000)
sg.vectors.standard.notes:
Motorola 68000 vector table.
Vector 0 contains the initial stack pointer.
Vector 1 contains the initial program counter.

regions.name: Initial Stack Pointer
regions.notes: Loaded into A7 on reset.

regions.name: Initial Program Counter
regions.notes: Execution starts here after reset.

regions.name: Exception Vector Table
regions.notes: Remaining exception and interrupt vectors.

sg.system.z80_map.name: SG/MD Z80 Subsystem Map
sg.system.z80_map.notes: Z80 RAM and bus control registers.

sg.cartridge.sram_map.name: SG/MD Cartridge SRAM Window
sg.cartridge.sram_map.notes: Commonly used address window for battery-backed SRAM.

regions.name: SRAM Window
regions.notes: Typical 64KB SRAM window.
